On this page

  • Money, Payments, and Digital Money
  • Banks, Deposits, and Financial Stability
  • Platforms, BigTech, and Network Effects
  • Credit Markets, Information, and Machine Learning
  • DeFi, Crypto, and Regulation

Sample Exam Questions

The following provides an indicative (non-exhaustive) list of typical exam questions. The questions are thematically grouped.

Money, Payments, and Digital Money

  • What is the fundamental economic role of money in a modern economy?
  • Why does the memory dimension of money interact with population growth. Explain using the framework of Kocherlakota.
  • Explain the key difference between Bitcoin and a Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) from a monetary policy perspective.
  • Give one advantage and one limitation of Bitcoin as a means of payment.
  • Explain the difference between money as a store of value and money as a unit of account. Why does this distinction matter for cryptocurrencies?
  • What problem do payment systems primarily aim to solve?

Banks, Deposits, and Financial Stability

  • What makes bank deposits economically distinct from other financial liabilities?
  • Explain why bank deposits are subject to self-fulfilling runs.
  • Why are bank runs fundamentally an incomplete information problem?
  • Using the Diamond–Dybvig framework, explain the value of deposit insurance
  • What moral hazard concern does deposit insurance create?

Platforms, BigTech, and Network Effects

  • What are network effects, and why are they particularly strong in digital financial platforms?
  • Why do network effects raise concerns for competition policy?
  • Give one example of a financial service where network effects can lead to market concentration.
  • What is a multi-sided platform?
  • What is the difference between price structure and price level? Why does it matter?
  • Explain the winner-takes-all phenomenon in platform markets. Give a platform strategy related to it.

Credit Markets, Information, and Machine Learning

  • What is the core information friction behind credit rationing?
  • Using the model of Stiglitz and Weiss, explain how adverse selection affects banks’ ability to price loans?
  • What type of cost does machine learning primarily reduce in financial markets?
  • Inside the framework of Stiglitz and Weiss, explain how can machine learning help address the issue of adverse selection.
  • Why can the adoption of machine learning lead to winner–loser reallocation among borrowers?
  • How can regulatory requirements (e.g. explainability) constrain the use of machine learning in banking?

DeFi, Crypto, and Regulation

  • How does the information structure of DeFi differ from that of traditional financial systems?
  • Why is credit screening particularly difficult in DeFi lending protocols?
  • What is the difference between microprudential and macroprudential regulation?
  • Why does DeFi pose challenges for traditional financial regulation frameworks?
